📚 Complete Curriculum

Comprehensive curriculum units integrating mātauranga Māori with NZ Curriculum standards

🌿 Cultural Context | Horopaki Ahurea

Whakataukī

"Ko te akoranga te pūtake o te ora"

"Education is the foundation of wellbeing"

🏛️ Connection to Mangakōtukutuku College Values

Whaimana: Integrity - Standing firm in truth and principle

This learning connects to the value of whaimana by encouraging students to [engage with content in ways that embody this value].

🛡️ Cultural Safety Considerations

  • Approach Māori content with respect and openness
  • Recognize students' diverse cultural backgrounds and experiences
  • Create space for Māori students to share their perspectives
  • Consult with whānau and local iwi for culturally sensitive topics

Year 7 / Level 3

🔢 Mathematics - Algebra

8 weeks | Pattern recognition & equations

Introduction to algebraic thinking through kowhaiwhai patterns and traditional Māori measurement.

Maths Māori Patterns

View Unit

🌿 Science - Ecosystems

6 weeks | Kaitiakitanga & biodiversity

Understanding ecosystems through the lens of kaitiakitanga (guardianship) and traditional Māori environmental knowledge.

Science Kaitiakitanga

View Unit

📖 Foundational Reading

10 weeks | Literacy development

Building reading comprehension and critical literacy skills with culturally responsive texts.

English Literacy

View Unit

💻 Digital Technology

8 weeks | Digital literacy

Introduction to digital technology concepts and computational thinking.

Technology

View Unit

🔍 Guided Inquiry: Society Design (Years 8-10) ⭐ FEATURED

🔍 Guided Inquiry: Society Design Unit

6 weeks | Project-Based Learning

Complete guided inquiry unit where students design their ideal society through collaborative exploration of governance, culture, and systems thinking. Includes 6 lessons + 24 worksheets.

Social Studies Systems Thinking 🌿 Cultural Focus

View Complete Unit Start Lesson 1

Year 10 / Level 5

🌟 Ranginui Walker - Challenge to the Narrative

5 weeks | Social Studies

Explore Dr. Ranginui Walker's life and work challenging dominant historical narratives. Understand Tino Rangatiratanga and the Māori Renaissance.

Social Studies Māori Leadership 🌿 Cultural Focus
📖 Lesson 1: Who was Walker? 📖 Lesson 2 📖 Lesson 3

🤖 AI Ethics & Māori Data Sovereignty

4 weeks | Digital Technology & Social Studies

Examine ethical considerations in AI through the lens of Māori data sovereignty and cultural protocols.

Technology Ethics 🌿 Cultural Focus
Start Lesson

🧬 Genetics & Whakapapa

5 weeks | Science

Explore genetics from both scientific and cultural perspectives, connecting DNA science with whakapapa (genealogy).

Science 🌿 Cultural Focus

🌍 Climate Change & Te Taiao

6 weeks | Science & Geography

Understand climate change through Te Taiao (Māori environmental worldview) and traditional ecological knowledge.

Science Geography 🌿 Cultural Focus

5 weeks | Social Studies

4 weeks | Science - Physics

Science Physics 🌿 Cultural Focus

Ko te pae tawhiti whāia kia tata, ko te pae tata whakamaua kia tīna

Seek the distant horizons, hold fast to those close at hand

"Whaowhia te kete mātauranga"

Fill the basket of knowledge

Quality teaching resources for Aotearoa New Zealand educators, honoring mātauranga Māori and contemporary pedagogy.
